tweets.text: Makes very depressing reading but we suspect things are much worse than the figures show. The @EnvAgency  have a bizarre way of counting spills. For example in 2020 the @RiverChess experienced 50 spills on consecutive days, they counted it as 1 spill. https://t.co/1AXYE2A3a0

@PJennings88 @EnvAgency @RiverChess But wait, government have a plan.

They're going to give water companies a legal duty to publish the sewage data. Oops they already have a legal duty, from 2015, see Fish Legal v Information Commissioner. (1./2)

Martin Hughes and his wife were flooded on Boxing Day 2015

He tells us his story of what it‚Äôs like to be flooded and shares his advice for others üëáüèº 

Know what to do in a flood: https://t.co/whMiqucyL6 #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/b52BSUBbky

Thanks to #SWLAQAG South West London Air Quality Action Group who have obtained the @EnvAgency CCS Non Compliance Report for incineratorüè≠ which reveals the 23 compliance issues.

Sadly the Enforcement Action reported
 1x No further action
 2x Advice/Further guidance
20x Warnings https://t.co/tVb6gbCam0

tweets.text:
And now we know why government have been so busy over the last couple of days.

In 2019 water companies spent over 3,100,000 hours, on over 400,000 occasions dumping sh*t into our rivers and seas.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/sUsBYs5msz

And here we have it. Appalled yes,shocked no. Said for long enough we are going backwards. Do the EA still state rivers are cleaner than 20 years ago when rivers was 92% good. Care to enlighten us @EmmaHowardBoyd or busy lifting your head from the shame. https://t.co/6L1NprPSM1

urls.title: Sewage discharged into rivers 400,000 times in 2020
urls.description: Waterways in England had sewage discharged into them for three million hours

tweets.text:
There is something missing from all the quotes from @DefraGovUK  and the @EnvAgency on sewage discharges today, when it comes to the @RiverChess these recent events are in breach of the water companies temporary permit to discharge untreated sewage.
https://t.co/l2QBu8FSLi
@SarahLudford @EnvAgency It seems like we talk about this every year and everybody just shrugs.

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency One reason for privatisation was separate regulator
Seems that scrutiny and accountability like much else these days is just so much old hat, we've moved onüôÑüò¢

‚ÄúIn the long term, we all want to see the end of damaging pollution that storm overflows cause.‚Äù

The relevant EU clean water directive is from 1991. How long term is long term for @EnvAgency? https://t.co/HUSYQZxyKf

We are protecting almost 5Ô∏è‚É£0Ô∏è‚É£0Ô∏è‚É£ properties in lovely #Seaford in #EastSussex from flooding...

We move shingle from each end of the beach twice a year... More often if needed...

Check our advice and info on preparing for flooding: https://t.co/oYz6tjEn71

Don‚Äôt wait!
#floodaware https://t.co/Cio256rQK2

urls.title: Event duration monitoring ‚Äì lifting the lid on storm overflows
urls.description: On today's blog we look into the 2020 Event Duration Monitoring Data, which is fundamental to understanding and improving the environment.¬†

tweets.text:
Storm overflows performance data to inland and coastal waters has been published for all water companies in England.

For information on storm overflows and a link to the full data and a summary of the key statistics, read our blog post: https://t.co/51zRnT2fSi https://t.co/cLtFlAR7jt

Data from @EnvAgency. Raw sewage is discharged into our rivers routinely during dry weather. How about applying some pressure @AndyBurnhamGM Manchester‚Äôs rivers are hit hard by this practice. urls.title: Police operation to stop thefts of catalytic converters
urls.description: Met officers have executed a number of warrants as part of an operation into the organised criminal theft of catalytic converters.

tweets.text:
This week the Joint Unit for Waste Crime supported the @metpoliceuk on raids across east London, Kent and Essex to stop catalytic converter thefts from vehicles.

The Joint Unit continues to tackle serious and organised #WasteCrime.

Read more: https://t.co/eusBkDuKDe https://t.co/BlrdUhEf45

domain.name: Political Body
domain.description: A section of a government, like The Supreme Court

tweets.text:
This shocking picture is a yard filled with illegally dumped construction and demolition waste. #WasteCrime harms our environment and economy. Make sure you dispose of construction waste legally, or risk being fined up to ¬£50,000 or face jail.

Read more: https://t.co/wMYPlu9tFt https://t.co/jE9enBIM9Z

Are you doing the right thing with building site waste? Waste criminals often take this waste and dump it illegally.

You're responsible for your waste even if you pass it to someone else. Follow these 4 simple steps to protect yourself from #WasteCrime:
https://t.co/ReD1Pr8Zi5 https://t.co/CxKPluz6cG

We‚Äôre working hard to tackle #WasteCrime. 

We‚Äôve developed a new tool that makes it easier for you to know if your waste carrier is registered with us. 

Find out more here: https://t.co/l4EG6rV1DW

Are you a registered waste carrier?

We‚Äôve developed a simple online tool that you can add to your website to show you're registered with us.

This helps your customers easily check at a glance you‚Äôre registered to carry waste legally.

Find out how here: https://t.co/iEgBuUxK8m https://t.co/BFdgrJfwlr

@AliDriverUK @Feargal_Sharkey @rollingpinboy @Thames21 @UnderwaterMedia @EnvAgencySE @thameswater Hi Ali, this is the ditch as you walk down past Shiplake College towards the river, just as you cross the ditch on a small footbridge. Thames Water suggested the fish kill was not a pollution incident but something to do with the farmer?!

Too often this happens to London's smaller rivers. 
Does this outfall have a monitor? 
Is it a sewer blockage overflowing into a pipe only meant for rain? 
The lack of data and accountability means we don't know, so the environment suffers. https://t.co/Yq9YfCSTiT

tweets.text: Hi @Feargal_Sharkey @rollingpinboy @Thames21 @AliDriverUK @UnderwaterMedia I reported this fish kill and suspected pollution incident to @EnvAgencySE. Their response was to ask @thameswater to investigate as the EA were under-resourced. Have you heard of this happening before?

We are responding to a serious fish kill at Newton-Le-Willows #StHelens. Our officers & @sthelenscouncil are investigating the cause & taking action to avoid any further fish deaths

Our thanks go to the fast-acting members of the public who reported this to us on 0800 80 70 60
